page.title: 13AMENITIES OF PENSARN
page.content: The village of Pensarn with its surrounding area has the following amenities mostly built for the tourist trade : a small Post Office, three take-away hot food shops, general stores, newsagent's, a betting shop, two public houses - The Highwayman and The Yacht, a local police station (backed up when needed by the larger Abergele station) , a butcher's by a grocer's, a railway station, a public park, a car salesroom, petrol station, public toilets, a club, a Presbyterian Church, camp sites made up of stationary caravans, and a Kwiksave supermarket. The supermarket was built, on the site of a Slater's used-car salesroom, in the 1970's near the Pensarn and Abergele railway station. Slater's was built on the old goods yard site used by the railway.
